uk.ac.cam.cl.juliet.test.messagedecoding

Class MockDatabaseConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.cl.juliet.test.messagedecoding.MockDatabaseConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatabaseConnection

    public class MockDatabaseConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements DatabaseConnection
    This is a mock database for testing purposes. Instead of actually writing messages to a database it counts the messages it gets and writes certain metrics to .csv-files.
    Author:
    Lucas Sonnabend

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MockDatabaseConnection(java.lang.String datapath, long symbolIndex)
      This will create a new MockDatabaseConnection that can be used for testing the packet processing and message decoding.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBatchQueryExecuteEndCallback(java.lang.Runnable r)
      Adds a runnable which will be executed whenever a batch statement has been executed.
      void addBatchQueryExecuteStartCallback(java.lang.Runnable r)
      Adds a runnable which will be executed whenever a batch statement is about to be executed.
      void addImbalanceMessage(long symbolIndex, long time_s, long time_ns, long symbolSeqNumber, long referencePrice)
      Insert information about a new imbalance message into the database.
      void addOrder(long orderID, long symbolIndex, long time_ns, long symbolSeqNumber, long price, long volume, boolean isSell, int tradeSession, long timestamp)
      Add a new order to the order book specified by the symbolIndex
      void addSourceTimeReference(long symbolIndex, long symbolSeqNumber, long referenceTime)
      Add a reference time to a stock specified by the symbol index The reference time maps to a symbol-sequence-number (other messages refer to this sequence number to specify a time in seconds)
      void addStockSummary(long symbolIndex, long time_s, long time_ns, long highPrice, long lowPrice, long openPrice, long closePrice, long totalVolume)
      Add a stock summary to database stock summary table.
      void addSymbolMappingEntry(long symbolIndex, java.lang.String symbol, long priceScaleCode, long prevClosingPrice, long prevClosingVolume)
      Add a symbol mapping entry to the database's symbol table
      void addTrade(long tradeID, long symbolIndex, long time_ns, long symbolSeqNumber, long price, long volume, long packetTimestamp)
      Add a trade to the database trade book
      void cancelTrade(long tradeID, long symbolIndex, long time_s, long time_ns, long symbolSeqNumber)
      Cancel a trade in the database This method will delete a trade record from the database to reflect the cancellation of the trade.
      void changeTradeSession(long symbolIndex, long time_s, long time_ns, long symbolSeqNumber, int tradingSession)
      Change the current trade session for the symbol specified All open orders that are not valid for the new trading session have to be deleted.
      void closeMockDatabase()
      This has to be called to close a PrintWriter stream the database is using
      void correctTrade(long originalTradeID, long tradeID, long symbolIndex, long time_s, long time_ns, long symbolSeqNumber, long price, long volume)
      Correct a trade entry in the database This method will alter an existing trade entry specified by originalTradeID.
      void deleteOrder(long orderID, long symbolIndex, long time_ns, long symbolSeqNumber, long timestamp)
      Delete an order from the database order book Note this method will delete an order book entry specified by both orderID and symbolIndex.
      java.sql.ResultSet getAllTradesInRecentHistory(long start)
      Gets all trades that happened in the time frame from start up to now ordered by the symbol ID
      java.sql.ResultSet getBestOffersForStock(long symbolID, int limit)
      Fetches the limit best offers for a given symbolId

      Return the time in nanoseconds that the last commit took.

      Queries the database and returns the trades for a specific symbol in a specific time range.

      Modify an existing active order book database entry This method overwrites the order book entry's attributes of price, volume, isSell and time.

      Reduce the volume of an order's order book database entry

      Set the connection to the database

      Call this method to write the accumulated information of the stock to a file.
      void writeStatisticsToFile()
      This method writes the accumulated statistics containing how many messages where seen per stock to a file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MockDatabaseConnection

        public MockDatabaseConnection(java.lang.String datapath,
                      long symbolIndex)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This will create a new MockDatabaseConnection that can be used for testing the packet processing and message decoding. It will create csv for symbol-index-mappings, an overview of how many and what kind of messages arrived for each symbol and a detailed list of every message for one symbol.
        Parameters:
        datapath - specifies the path, at which the created .csv files are stored, it must NOT end with a slash
        symbolIndex - the symbolIndex of the stock of which a detailed log is created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • closeMockDatabase

        public void closeMockDatabase()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This has to be called to close a PrintWriter stream the database is using
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public void writeSingleStockeLog()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Call this method to write the accumulated information of the stock to a file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeStatisticsToFile

        public void writeStatisticsToFile()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the accumulated statistics containing how many messages where seen per stock to a file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addOrder

        public void addOrder(long orderID,
            long symbolIndex,
            long time_ns,
            long symbolSeqNumber,
            long price,
            long volume,
            boolean isSell,
            int tradeSession,
            long timestamp)
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Add a new order to the order book specified by the symbolIndex
        Specified by:
        addOrder in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        orderID - unique orderID of the new order
        symbolIndex - symbolIndex of the stock, determining the order book
        time_ns - timestamp from the sender in nanoseconds
        symbolSeqNumber - symbol-sequence-number of the message for this symbol index
        price - price of the order
        volume - volume of the order
        isSell - true if it is sell/ask order and false if it is buy/bid
        tradeSession - trade sessions for which the order is valid
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • modifyOrder

        public void modifyOrder(long orderID,
               long symbolIndex,
               long time_ns,
               long symbolSeqNumber,
               long price,
               long volume,
               boolean isSell,
               long timestamp)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Modify an existing active order book database entry This method overwrites the order book entry's attributes of price, volume, isSell and time. It has no effect to the database if the order no longer exists in the order book.
        Specified by:
        modifyOrder in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        orderID - order ID of the order to be modified
        symbolIndex - defines the stock and the order-book in which the order resides
        time_ns - timestamp from the sender in nanoseconds
        symbolSeqNumber - symbol-sequence-number of the message for this symbol index
        price - potential new price of the order
        volume - potential new volume of the order
        isSell - true if it is sell/ask order and false if it is buy/bid
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • reduceOrderVolume

        public void reduceOrderVolume(long orderID,
                     long symbolIndex,
                     long time_ns,
                     long symbolSeqNumber,
                     long volumeReduction,
                     long packetTimestamp)
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Reduce the volume of an order's order book database entry
        Specified by:
        reduceOrderVolume in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        orderID - The order ID of the order that is to be reduced
        symbolIndex - The symbol index of the stock for which the order was made
        time_ns - Time stamp from the sender in nanoseconds
        symbolSeqNumber - symbol-sequence-number of the message for this symbol index
        volumeReduction - the amount by which the volume is reduced
        packetTimestamp - The timestamp from the sender of the packet in seconds

      • addTrade

        public void addTrade(long tradeID,
            long symbolIndex,
            long time_ns,
            long symbolSeqNumber,
            long price,
            long volume,
            long packetTimestamp)
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Add a trade to the database trade book
        Specified by:
        addTrade in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        tradeID - unique trade ID of the trade
        symbolIndex - symbol index of the traded stock
        time_ns - time of the sender in nanoseconds
        symbolSeqNumber - sequence number of this message and the symbol index
        price - price at which the stock is traded
        volume - volume that is traded
        packetTimestamp - timestamp of the packet from the sender in seconds
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addStockSummary

        public void addStockSummary(long symbolIndex,
                   long time_s,
                   long time_ns,
                   long highPrice,
                   long lowPrice,
                   long openPrice,
                   long closePrice,
                   long totalVolume)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Add a stock summary to database stock summary table. NOTE: there are no stock summary messages in the sample data stream
        Specified by:
        addStockSummary in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        symbolIndex - symbol index of the stock.
        time_s - time stamp of the sender for this message in seconds
        time_ns - time stamp of the sender for this message in nanoseconds
        highPrice - highest trading price seen so far
        lowPrice - lowest trading price seen so far
        openPrice - opening price of the stock
        closePrice - closing price of the stock
        totalVolume - total volume traded so far
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • correctTrade

        public void correctTrade(long originalTradeID,
                long tradeID,
                long symbolIndex,
                long time_s,
                long time_ns,
                long symbolSeqNumber,
                long price,
                long volume)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Correct a trade entry in the database This method will alter an existing trade entry specified by originalTradeID.
        Specified by:
        correctTrade in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        originalTradeID - original trade ID of the trade that is to be corrected
        tradeID - new trade ID
        symbolIndex - symbol index of the stock that was traded
        time_s - time stamp of the sender (on sending the message) in seconds
        time_ns - time stamp of the sender (on sending the message), only the nanoseconds part
        symbolSeqNumber - sequence number of this message for this symbol index
        price - price at which the stock was traded
        volume - volume that was traded
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addSourceTimeReference

        public void addSourceTimeReference(long symbolIndex,
                          long symbolSeqNumber,
                          long referenceTime)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Add a reference time to a stock specified by the symbol index The reference time maps to a symbol-sequence-number (other messages refer to this sequence number to specify a time in seconds)
        Specified by:
        addSourceTimeReference in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        symbolIndex - specifies the stock the time reference is connected to
        symbolSeqNumber - sequence number of a sequence that is unique for every symbol index
        referenceTime - time in seconds (EPOCH) the sequence number maps to
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addSymbolMappingEntry

        public void addSymbolMappingEntry(long symbolIndex,
                         java.lang.String symbol,
                         long priceScaleCode,
                         long prevClosingPrice,
                         long prevClosingVolume)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Add a symbol mapping entry to the database's symbol table
        Specified by:
        addSymbolMappingEntry in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        symbolIndex - The ID of the symbol.
        symbol - The name of the symbol.
        priceScaleCode - The amount which the prices of orders and trades are scaled by.
        prevClosingPrice - The last closing price of the symbol.
        prevClosingVolume - The last closing volume of the symbol.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • cancelTrade

        public void cancelTrade(long tradeID,
               long symbolIndex,
               long time_s,
               long time_ns,
               long symbolSeqNumber)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Cancel a trade in the database This method will delete a trade record from the database to reflect the cancellation of the trade.
        Specified by:
        cancelTrade in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        tradeID - the trade ID of the trade to cancel
        symbolIndex - the stock to which the trade relates
        time_s - timestamp from the sender in seconds
        time_ns - timestamp from the sender in nanoseconds
        symbolSeqNumber - symbol-sequence-number of the stock - refers to an epoch timestamp in seconds for this stock
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • changeTradeSession

        public void changeTradeSession(long symbolIndex,
                      long time_s,
                      long time_ns,
                      long symbolSeqNumber,
                      int tradingSession)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        Change the current trade session for the symbol specified All open orders that are not valid for the new trading session have to be deleted.
        Specified by:
        changeTradeSession in interface DatabaseConnection
        Parameters:
        symbolIndex - The ID of the symbol for which the trading session is changing.
        time_s - The seconds part of the time at which the session changed.
        time_ns - The nanoseconds part of the time at which the session changed.
        symbolSeqNumber - The sequence number of the trading session change message.
        tradingSession - Flags which indicate the new session.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Specified by:

        Throws:

      • getSpreadOfSymbol

        public long getSpreadOfSymbol(long symbolIndex)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConnection
        returns the difference between the lowest offer and the highest bid of the stock specified by the symbol index. If either of them don't exists, it returns 0. The price scale of the stock has NOT YET been applied to the result
        Specified by:
        getSpreadOfSymbol in interface DatabaseConnection
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
